channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Amazon to Pay $2.5 Billion for Allegedly Duping Millions to Sign Up for Prime
item.description: Amazon takes in around $2.5 billion in sales every 33 hours. Some customers will automatically receive $51.

item.title: These Stripe Alums Just Raised $19 Million to Fix AI Agents
item.description: Circuit & Chisel is building a protocol it hopes will do for AI agents what HTTP did for the web—and fintech giants are backing it.

item.title: Don’t try to be funny at work unless you want to risk your job and any chance of ever getting promoted, management professors say
item.description: Funny ideas can be good. Nebraska’s tourism board won with “Honestly, it’s not for everyone," and Patagonia boosted sales with “Don’t Buy This Jacket....

item.title: SBA To Cut Fees For Small Manufacturers. Is This Tariff Help In Disguise?
item.description: The SBA has been intent on preserving the credibility of its loan programs. How can it afford to grant fee waivers?

item.title: The August home sales mystery: Top analyst says ‘implausible’ housing market data ‘defies credulity’
item.description: Pantheon Macroeconomics' Oliver Allen says it's "inexplicable" that new home sales would jump to their highest level in more than three years all of a...

item.title: DOGE put your Social Security Number on a cloud server with up to a 65% risk of getting hacked: Senate report
item.description: A newly released report from Senate Democrats alleges the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has “copied Americans’ sensitive Social Security ...

item.title: Behind the fall and resurrection of Jimmy Kimmel is a $6.2 billion merger and the pro-Republican companies that serve rural, conservative audiences
item.description: FCC pressure and multibillion-dollar mergers aren’t even the full story. The future of linear TV is up for grabs.

item.title: Trump told pregnant women to ‘tough it out’ instead of take Tylenol. A study of 2.5 million births in Sweden finds zero evidence to back him up
item.description: A dataset of children born between 1995 and 2019 who were tracked for years afterward offered scientists a rare opportunity to investigate drug use.

item.title: Telehealth for Medicare patients is on the chopping block as Congress narrows in on an extension deadline. ‘The uncertainty creates a lack of trust,’ healthcare CEO says
item.description: If nothing is passed, on Oct. 1, many Medicare members won’t be able to access telemedicine from their homes anymore.

item.title: Why ‘Radical’ Leadership Styles Can Lead to Mediocre Performance
item.description: Angrily tearing down company processes and precedents in a hard-nosed hunt for better profits can work. But it’s more likely to cause harm.

item.title: Accenture reports strong Q4 revenue and unveils a $865 million restructuring
item.description: Accenture beat fourth-quarter revenue estimates and unveiled a six‑month, $865 million restructuring to realign its workforce and operations for risin...

item.title: How to transfer your music library from one streaming service to another
item.description: Want to switch to Apple Music because you can’t find your favorite indie band on Spotify ? Or maybe you’re on Amazon Music but saw a new subscriber of...

item.title: U.S. economy grew more than expected in the second quarter, at a 3.8% pace
item.description: An uptick in consumer spending helped the U.S. economy expand at a surprising 3.8% from April through June, the government reported in a dramatic upgr...

item.title: Disney investors blast Kimmel suspension as politics over profit
item.description: If you think Jimmy Kimmel’s return to late night television this week spells the end of that whole saga, well, think again: A group of investors is de...

item.title: This Company Says 1 New AI Feature Can Handle 20 Hours of Work in Seconds
item.description: The Knot is bringing AI to wedding planning, and a new feature is designed to simplify one specific part of the process.

item.title: She inherited $600,000 in Apple shares and wants to know if it’s safe to hang on
All living former Fed chairs petition Supreme Court on Lisa Cook’s behalf
Could the Fed skip a rate cut next month?
Dow, S&P and Nasdaq end lower for 3rd straight day amid rethink on Fed rate cuts
